metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9104 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the (1) v9fs_xattr_read and (2)v9fs_xattr_write functions in hw/9pfs/9p.c in QEMU (aka Quick Emulator)allow local guest OS administrators to cause a denial of service (QEMUprocess crash) via a crafted offset, which triggers an out-of-boundsaccess.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9104` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30').
